hackathon-description-text: HackDelft is the first hackathon organized by TU Delft's W.I.S.V 'Christiaan Huygens'. On May 13th and 14th, join 100 other students interested in math, computer science or design for 24 hours of learning, building, and having fun. This year's theme is #trendhacking, and we're excited to work with our four premium partners to provide HackDelft-exclusive tools and data for you to hack with this year!
hackathon-requirements: Please submit the main GitHub repository of your project - make sure it includes a short overview of your project in the repo's README.md!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The project that best solves KPMG's case: Security and IoT.
The project that best solves Optiver's case: Finding Value in Trading Data
The project that best solves Aegon's case: Protecting your privacy
The project that best solves de Volkbank's case: It’s all in the balance

Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Innovation in the topic and/or combination of existing approaches and/or new approach and/or pragmatism of the approach.
Learning progress made by the team members in terms of technologies, methods, process and/or engineering.
Insight into ethical and/or practical implications of the work.
Quality and convincingness of the pitch.

hackathon-description-header: TU Delft's first hackathon, organized by the study association W.I.S.V. 'Christiaan Huygens'!
